page.title: 19BUCKLEY DETENTION CENTRE
page.content: The boys sleep in dormitories and are often allowed out during the day.Also they scrub floors and clean the toilets.They work on a dairy farm for 12 hours, 7 days a week.Occasionally they go out at weekends on hikes,walks and to camps.They have 3 hot meals a day and go to bed at 9.00p.m. and get up at 6.00a.m.They get about Â£1.17 a week pocket money and are not allowed to smoke or drink.When their visitors have left the boys are checked to see that nothing has been passed on. They are provided with striped shirts,jeans and a denim jacket to work in. If the boys do not behave whilst they are there they have to stay on longer. The total area of Buckley Hall is 105 acres.It is situated in a quiet place 2 miles from the centre of Rochdale.
